name: Clippings.com
description:
http://www.clippings.com is revolutionising how people discover and shop for furniture, with the marketplace to buy directly from more than 850 of world’s leading brands. We will become the destination for design online, bringing together a £80b global industry that is incredibly fragmented and painfully inefficient.

http://www.clippings.pro, our B2B platform that enables Architects, Interior designers and Decorators to discovery, specify and buy products for residential, hospitality or commercial projects is the fastest growing part of our business, with 100% MoM revenue growth, £1,700 AOV and a 5.5% conversion rate to purchase.

team.title: COO
team.name: Tom Mallory
team.bioHtml: Co-founder/COO at Clippings.com. I work on companies that communicate the value of great design.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Adel Zakout
team.bioHtml: Architect turned Entrepreneur. CEO/Co-founder of Clippings.com. Previously founded OpenBuildings.com (wiki for buildings) & Despark (50 person digital agency)

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We're looking for software engineers to join our world class team, to help us develop our platform to the next level and shape the future of this industry!

Responsibilities will include:

- Your work will include back-end and front-end development.
- You will deliver functionality to fulfil the annual and quarterly objectives of the company.
- You will refactor the codebase to increase flexibility and maintainability.
- You will improve the different products, tools and integrations of the Clippings platform.
- You will participate in the whole sprint process for product development.
- You will work with the dev team, the Head of Product and key stakeholders.
- You'd be able to provide feedback and suggestions on what we're building.

What we're looking for:

- 5+ years of experience as a developer with web related technologies
- Experience with dynamic languages such as PHP, JavaScript, Ruby or Python
- Strong focus on code quality and maintainability
- Good knowledge of and experience with SOLID design principles
- Ability to implement new functionality from start to finish
- Initiative for improving processes, codebase and implementing new techniques
- Excellent English - speaking and writing
- Nice to have experience with:
  * Symfony framework & components
  * Doctrine ORM
  * React.JS
  * Ecommerce platforms
  * On-site SEO
  * Basic Linux administration

What we're offering:

- Join a world-class tech team and play a key role in a fast-growing start-up
- Exceptional transparency, freedom and the opportunity to develop your skills/knowledge
- Competitive salary & share options
- Flexible working hours and work from home
- Top equipment: Apple MacBook Pro, Herman Miller chair

jobs.title: Project Manager – Larger B2B Accounts Focus
jobs.description:
You will be a member of the growing Customer Success and Operations team and will get involved with all of our processes.

<<<<Responsibilities>>>>

- Own the complete post-sale customer journey for our larger B2B accounts. Whilst your focus will be on post-sale, you’ll also partner with our Trade Account Management Team to deal with operational pre-sale enquiries and to help win sales. 
- Project manage customer orders post-sale proactively through to successful delivery. An order could be multiple items consolidated from different brands, right up to complex delivery and installation projects. You will: place orders with brands; confirm orders; monitor and manage lead times; manage post-sale customer communications and relationship; collate any operations and maintenance manual materials required; spot problems and resolve them before they become problems; arrange deliveries and installations; visit customer sites as needed to ensure successful delivery, installation and snagging resolution; and offer an end to end personal after-sales experience.
- Act as an internal partner for each Trade Account Manager, pairing-up with them to provide a seamless, outstanding level of service from pre-sale through to post sale.
- Liaise with our warehouse and other external logistics partners to coordinate brand orders, order consolidation, dispatches, customer deliveries and installations.
- Manage customer enquiries via email and phone in a friendly, helpful and professional manner – representing the Clippings brand and Clippings customer experience.
- Work closely with customers to ensure they are satisfied with the products and services they receive and to improve upon areas of dissatisfaction.
- Pass on any valuable customer feedback to the team, as well as your own ideas and improvements, for us to optimise our service and product, and maintain excellent customer satisfaction and Net Promoter Score. We welcome input from every team member.
- Work with other members of the team with sales, marketing, product and operational tasks related to your role.


<<<<What we're looking for>>>>

- Experience of a customer facing position for at least 2 years in an ecommerce environment. You might have worked in customer service, or in a wider customer ownership, customer success, customer experience or other customer-facing role. You will be passionate about delivery of a premium product and outstanding service for demanding customers.
- A big plus is to have furniture, lighting or home accessories experience, and/or a passion for design and furniture.
- Experience of using Front or a similar CRM application to manage customer contacts and conversations is beneficial. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills, to use the right language and tone of voice to manage effective conversations and outcomes with customers and brands.
- Project management know-how: managing workload and priorities; applying planning and structure to get activities done; stakeholder management; and a focus on achieving results.
- Knowledge of operational processes to manage ordering, lead times, deliveries and returns.
- We’re looking for someone with a highly personable attitude, who can work in a fast-paced, start-up environment. Your creative and innovative thinking will enable you to develop customer-focused approaches to go the extra mile for the customer. Your ownership mentality gives you the ability to work independently as needed. You have a high bar of excellence, with the ability to take feedback and criticism without ego.
- We’re looking for an ambitious person who is looking to develop their career path in customer success and more complex installation project management and who wants to learn and develop skills fast.


<<<<What we're offering>>>>

- The opportunity to join a world-class team and play a key role in a fast-growing start-up that is revolutionising the design industry.
- The opportunity to grow professionally as the company grows.
- A working environment that offers an exceptional freedom and the opportunity to develop your skills and knowledge at an extremely fast pace.
- Competitive salary.
- Designer furnished, spacious loft office.
- Free team lunches twice a month.


<<<<Who we are>>>>

Clippings is using technology to revolutionise the interior design industry. We're the UK's fastest growing source for furniture and lighting, with thousands of interior designers and architects using our platform to manage their projects from inspiration to installation.
We're disrupting this fragmented industry and completely reimagining the design process. What was once a manual, time-consuming ordeal is now instant, so interior designers can spend more time doing the creative work that this profession is really all about.
Our founders are serial entrepreneurs who first met at architecture school. We're VC-backed by industry veterans.
Working here is intense, challenging and rewarding. If you thrive on ambitious goals, constant learning and getting stuck in, we're offering an unrivalled chance to realise your potential in a key role at a fast-paced start-up with global ambitions.


Get in touch with us if you feel that you match the description!

Apply via this link for a faster response: https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/clippingscom/view/P_AAAAABkAABCOJFo6-AshDC

jobs.title: B2B CRM Manager
jobs.description:
We're looking for a bright and talented B2B CRM manager to manage all our email campaigns. Joining our marketing team and reporting to our VP of Marketing, you'll own and execute the CRM marketing strategy and manage all the CRM data infrastructure. This is a full-time role based at our office in Shoreditch. If you're creative, analytical, organised and keen to work in an environment where you're learning all the time, this role is for you.

Responsibilities
Own the execution of all email marketing strategies.
Build, test, schedule and send broadcast and automated email campaigns.
Maintain a map of all email journeys and ensure consistent experiences for users.
Develop a deep nurturing flow for sophisticated B2B customer segments.
Maintain all the CRM systems and databases required to deliver this strategy.
Brief engineering teams on work needed to maintain and develop CRM infrastructure.
Collaborate with internal and external content creators and designers to deliver assets.
Measure, analyse and report on results to drive actionable insights.

What we're looking for
1-2 years of experience in a B2B CRM role.
Experience with at least one email automation platform, ideally Pardot.
Flawless written English and exceptional copywriting skills.
A passion for design, architecture and interior design.
Analytical skills; ability to interpret data and insight to drive improvement.
Creative thinker, with an eye for design and meticulous attention to detail.

What we're offering
The opportunity to join a world-class team with global ambitions.
The chance to play a key role in the start-up revolutionising the design industry.
Support to develop your skills and knowledge at an extremely fast pace.
Ownership of your work and recognition for the results you can achieve. 
Designer furnished spacious loft office in Shoreditch.
Competitive salary.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Clippings is the fastest growing platform for interior design, offering a new way to source products and manage projects from inspiration to installation. We're using technology to develop smarter streamlined processes that reduce the time, friction and cost required to create exceptional spaces. The company was founded in 2014 by Adel Zakout and Tom Mallory. Clippings is backed by Advance Venture Partners and C4 Ventures, and in 2018 raised a $15.4 million series B round led by Advance Venture Partners.

We're looking for Software Engineer to join our Growth team, to help us develop our platform to the next level and shape the future of this industry!


Responsibilities will include:

Your work will include back-end and front-end development
You will be responsible for researching and building tools that help various sales and marketing endeavours such as SEO, Analytics, Landing pages, Onboarding experiences
You will work with various tools like Salesforce, Google analytics, Heap analytics, Google Tag Manager
You will deliver functionality to fulfil the annual and quarterly objectives of the company
You will improve the different products, tools and integrations of the Clippings platform
You will participate in the whole process for product development.
You will work with the dev team, the Head of Growth and key stakeholders
You'd be able to provide feedback and suggestions on what we're building

What we're looking for:

2+ years of web development
Experience with dynamic languages such as PHP, JavaScript, Ruby or Python
Insight into the inner workings of the Growth domain - SEO, sales and revenue, user conversion and retention, statistics
Focus on code quality and maintainability
Good knowledge of and experience with SOLID design principles
Ability to implement new functionality from start to finish
Initiative for improving processes, codebase and implementing new techniques
Very good English - speaking and writing

It would be an advantage to have experience with:

Experience with sales and marketing tools and frameworks
Symfony framework & components
Doctrine ORM
SQL
React.JS
Ecommerce platforms
Basic Linux administration

What we're offering:

Join a world-class tech team and play a key role in a fast-growing start-up
Exceptional transparency, freedom and the opportunity to develop your skills/knowledge
Competitive salary & share options
Flexible working hours & possibility for remote work
Top equipment: Apple MacBook Pro, Herman Miller chair
25 vacation days

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.
All applications will be treated in strict confidentiality.
